Uses of Interface
org.stekikun.dolmen.debug.TokenVisualizer.LexerInterface

  • Packages that use TokenVisualizer.LexerInterface 
    Package Description
    org.stekikun.dolmen.debug
    This package contains generic utility functions to help debug Dolmen-generated lexical analyzers and parsers.

    • Uses of TokenVisualizer.LexerInterface in org.stekikun.dolmen.debug

      Methods in org.stekikun.dolmen.debug that return TokenVisualizer.LexerInterface 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <L extends LexBuffer,T,Cat>
      TokenVisualizer.LexerInterface<L,T,Cat>      		 TokenVisualizer.LexerInterface.of(BiFunction<String,Reader,L> makeLexer, Function<L,T> entry, Function<T,Cat> categorizer, T eofToken)
      Typical usage of this method when MyLexer has been generated by Dolmen with a main entry point and uses some Token.EOF token for the end-of-input: LexerInterface.of(MyLexer::new, MyLexer::main, Token::getClass, Token.EOF)
      Methods in org.stekikun.dolmen.debug with parameters of type TokenVisualizer.LexerInterface 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <L extends LexBuffer,T,Cat>
      void      		 TokenVisualizer.file(TokenVisualizer.LexerInterface<L,T,Cat> lexer, String input, String output)
      Outputs to the given output file a stand-alone HTML page which displays the tokenization of the given input file contents.
      static <L extends LexBuffer,T,Cat>
      void      		 TokenVisualizer.string(TokenVisualizer.LexerInterface<L,T,Cat> lexer, String input, Writer output)
      Outputs to the given writer a stand-alone HTML page which displays the tokenization of the given input string's contents.
      static <L extends LexBuffer,T,Cat>
      void      		 TokenVisualizer.visualize(TokenVisualizer.LexerInterface<L,T,Cat> lexer, String inputName, Reader input, Writer output)
      Outputs to the given writer a stand-alone HTML page which displays the tokenization of the given input contents.
